page.title: 03Blanche Heriot Legend
page.content: The story set in 1471 is about Blanche Heriot and her lover, who was fighting in the Wars of the Roses. Captured by Yorkists, he was to be killed at Chertsey Meads, at the ringing of the Curfew Bell, rung every night for the last 600 years. He had one chance to escape death by sending his ring to the King, but the messenger would have arrived too late. In order to save her lover, Blanche climbed up the bell tower and clung to the clapper. When the bell was rung, there was no sound, so Neville, her cousin and lover, was saved. The Bell, saved from Chertsey Abbey at the time of the dissolution, now hangs in St. Peter's Church. This legend inspired the writing of two poems and a play.
